p: Among the 20 laboratory parameters measured, four did not show significant differences among the three groups. In contrast, 8 parameters, such as white blood cells (WBC), neutrophils (NEU), platelets (PLT), hemoglobin (Hb), C-reactive protein (CRP), interleukin-6 (IL-6), IL-10, and IL-2R, showed significant differences between the severe and critical groups. However, these differences did not exist between critical non-survivors and survivors (Fig.Â 1d). Therefore, we inferred that severe and critical patients could be clearly distinguished by clinical parameters, but clinical data resolution was insufficient to clarify critical patients with different outcomes.
